alert.note: Alert for Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:08PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Windham County through 845 PM EDT... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Guilford Center, or 7 miles southwest of Brattleboro, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Brattleboro, Putney, Vernon, Guilford Center, Guilford, Marlboro, Halifax, Jacksonville, North Vernon, East Dummerston, East Putney, Fairview Village, Four Corners, Dummerston Center, Putney Station, Green River, Williamsville Station, West Halifax, Whitneyville and West Dummerston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
